channel.title: Grabbing a website code/Finding data
channel.description: ########.com/login.php I want to grab that (Yes, I hashed the adress) as it immediately redirects me to another site. How can I grab it via .bat or .php code? [hr] Nvm, I fixed. Now, I want to find where it saves the data to, here is the code: [code] <!-- Mirrored from ######/login.php by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sun, 17 May 2009 11:41:41 GMT --> <HEAD> <SCRIPT language="JavaScript"> <!-- window.location="fail.htm"; //--> </SCRIPT> </HEAD> ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â»Ã‚Â¿[/code]

item.title: Grabbing a website code/Finding data
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

[quote=“Halogenisation, post:1, topic:278890”][quote author=ranger squad link=topic=368045.msg2787710#msg2787710 date=1242576800]
No, It’s an rs phishing site, I want to store the passwords and usernames.
www.google.net
[/quote]

You want to steal the usernames and passwords from a phishing site…?

Oh I see what you mean, yes they will probably be stored in a text file somewhere but you can’t view their PHP source code unless they kindly uploaded a .phps version for your password stealing needs.[/quote]

actually i would like to meet some some who is retarded enough to store them in a .txt file… really if you have to store them at all… do it in a DB sheesh!

Read full topic

item.title: Grabbing a website code/Finding data

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

PHP is interpreted server-side; you won’t be able to grab the script.
